bug.author: timoklimmer
bug.summary: Named package extras do not exist
bug.description:
The package extras named in the article do not exist. Please provide the correct extra names and ideally give us more insights about the packages on <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/user/amlpypi>https://pypi.org/user/amlpypi</denchmark-link> . When should we install which package? I am really confused from this package zoo... <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: 8e0e12a4-b363-2726-06b4-9db2015efb32 Version Independent ID: e39a91ac-375b-a2cc-350d-a82cb7b0b035 Content: Install the Azure Machine Learning SDK for Python - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML-Docset/docs-ref-conceptual/install.md Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @harneetvirk Microsoft Alias: harnvir

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/timoklimmer>@timoklimmer</denchmark-link> if you look on the left pane of the install page on the help you can find description for the most of the zoo inhabitants. From the page you can get information or links for particular scenarios, samples and use case guidance <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21002116/94695542-05fab100-0304-11eb-93fc-513dc723b833.png></denchmark-link>
